segment.source: Exclude Files and Settings (Windows 10)
segment.target: Exclude Files and Settings (Windows 10)

segment.source: Exclude Files and Settings
segment.target: Exclude Files and Settings

segment.source: Exclude Files and Settings
segment.target: Exclude Files and Settings

segment.source: When you specify the migration .xml files, MigApp.xml, Migdocs, and MigUser.xml, the User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 migrates the settings and components listed, as discussed in What Does USMT Migrate?
segment.target: When you specify the migration .xml files, MigApp.xml, Migdocs, and MigUser.xml, the User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 migrates the settings and components listed, as discussed in What Does USMT Migrate?

segment.source: You can create a custom .xml file to further specify what to include or exclude in the migration.
segment.target: You can create a custom .xml file to further specify what to include or exclude in the migration.

segment.source: In addition you can create a Config.xml file to exclude an entire component from a migration.
segment.target: In addition you can create a Config.xml file to exclude an entire component from a migration.

segment.source: You cannot, however, exclude users by using the migration .xml files or the Config.xml file.
segment.target: You cannot, however, exclude users by using the migration .xml files or the Config.xml file.

segment.source: The only way to specify which users to include and exclude is by using the User options on the command line in the ScanState tool.
segment.target: The only way to specify which users to include and exclude is by using the User options on the command line in the ScanState tool.

segment.source: For more information, see ScanState Syntax.
segment.target: For more information, see ScanState Syntax.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Create a custom .xml file.
segment.target: Create a custom .xml file.

segment.source: You can use the following elements to specify what to exclude:
segment.target: You can use the following elements to specify what to exclude:

segment.source: include and exclude: You can use the include and exclude elements to exclude objects with conditions.
segment.target: include and exclude: You can use the include and exclude elements to exclude objects with conditions.

segment.source: For example, you can migrate all files located in the C: drive, except any .mp3 files.
segment.target: For example, you can migrate all files located in the C: drive, except any .mp3 files.

segment.source: It is important to remember that Conflicts and Precedence apply to these elements.
segment.target: It is important to remember that Conflicts and Precedence apply to these elements.

segment.source: unconditionalExclude: You can use the unconditionalExclude element to globally exclude data.
segment.target: unconditionalExclude: You can use the unconditionalExclude element to globally exclude data.

segment.source: This element takes precedence over all other include and exclude rules in the .xml files.
segment.target: This element takes precedence over all other include and exclude rules in the .xml files.

segment.source: Therefore, this element excludes objects regardless of any other include rules that are in the .xml files.
segment.target: Therefore, this element excludes objects regardless of any other include rules that are in the .xml files.

segment.source: For example, you can exclude all .mp3 files on the computer, or you can exclude all files from C:UserData.
segment.target: For example, you can exclude all .mp3 files on the computer, or you can exclude all files from C:UserData.

segment.source: Create a Config.xml File: You can create and modify a Config.xml file to exclude an entire component from the migration.
segment.target: Create a Config.xml File: You can create and modify a Config.xml file to exclude an entire component from the migration.

segment.source: For example, you can use this file to exclude the settings for one of the default applications.
segment.target: For example, you can use this file to exclude the settings for one of the default applications.

segment.source: In addition, creating and modifying a Config.xml file is the only way to exclude the operating-system settings that are migrated to computers running Windows.
segment.target: In addition, creating and modifying a Config.xml file is the only way to exclude the operating-system settings that are migrated to computers running Windows.

segment.source: Excluding components using this file is easier than modifying the migration .xml files because you do not need to be familiar with the migration rules and syntax.
segment.target: Excluding components using this file is easier than modifying the migration .xml files because you do not need to be familiar with the migration rules and syntax.

segment.source: Create a custom .xml file
segment.target: Create a custom .xml file

segment.source: We recommend that you create a custom .xml file instead of modifying the default migration .xml files.
segment.target: We recommend that you create a custom .xml file instead of modifying the default migration .xml files.

segment.source: When you use a custom .xml file, you can keep your changes separate from the default .xml files, which makes it easier to track your modifications.
segment.target: When you use a custom .xml file, you can keep your changes separate from the default .xml files, which makes it easier to track your modifications.

segment.source: include and exclude
segment.target: include and exclude

segment.source: The migration .xml files, MigApp.xml, MigDocs, and MigUser.xml, contain the component element, which typically represents a self-contained component or an application such as Microsoft® Office Outlook® and Word.
segment.target: The migration .xml files, MigApp.xml, MigDocs, and MigUser.xml, contain the component element, which typically represents a self-contained component or an application such as Microsoft® Office Outlook® and Word.

segment.source: To exclude the files and registry settings that are associated with these components, use the include and exclude elements.
segment.target: To exclude the files and registry settings that are associated with these components, use the include and exclude elements.

segment.source: For example, you can use these elements to migrate all files and settings with pattern X except files and settings with pattern Y, where Y is more specific than X. For the syntax of these elements, see USMT XML Reference.
segment.target: For example, you can use these elements to migrate all files and settings with pattern X except files and settings with pattern Y, where Y is more specific than X. For the syntax of these elements, see USMT XML Reference.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you specify an exclude rule, always specify a corresponding include rule.
segment.target: If you specify an exclude rule, always specify a corresponding include rule.

segment.source: Otherwise, if you do not specify an include rule, the specific files or settings will not be included.
segment.target: Otherwise, if you do not specify an include rule, the specific files or settings will not be included.

segment.source: They will already be excluded from the migration.
segment.target: They will already be excluded from the migration.

segment.source: Thus, an unaccompanied exclude rule is unnecessary.
segment.target: Thus, an unaccompanied exclude rule is unnecessary.

segment.source: Example 1: How to migrate all files from C: except .mp3 files
segment.target: Example 1: How to migrate all files from C: except .mp3 files

segment.source: Example 2: How to migrate all files located in C:Data except files in C:Datatmp
segment.target: Example 2: How to migrate all files located in C:Data except files in C:Datatmp

segment.source: Example 3: How to exclude the files in a folder but include all subfolders
segment.target: Example 3: How to exclude the files in a folder but include all subfolders

segment.source: Example 4: How to exclude a file from a specific folder
segment.target: Example 4: How to exclude a file from a specific folder

segment.source: Example 5: How to exclude a file from any location
segment.target: Example 5: How to exclude a file from any location

segment.source: Example 1: How to migrate all files from C: except .mp3 files
segment.target: Example 1: How to migrate all files from C: except .mp3 files

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates all files located on the C: drive, except any .mp3 files.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates all files located on the C: drive, except any .mp3 files.

segment.source: Example 2: How to migrate all files located in C:Data except files in C:Datatmp
segment.target: Example 2: How to migrate all files located in C:Data except files in C:Datatmp

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates all files and subfolders in C:Data, except the files and subfolders in C:Datatmp.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates all files and subfolders in C:Data, except the files and subfolders in C:Datatmp.

segment.source: Example 3: How to exclude the files in a folder but include all subfolders
segment.target: Example 3: How to exclude the files in a folder but include all subfolders

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates any subfolders in C:EngineeringDrafts, but excludes all files that are in C:EngineeringDrafts.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates any subfolders in C:EngineeringDrafts, but excludes all files that are in C:EngineeringDrafts.

segment.source: Example 4: How to exclude a file from a specific folder
segment.target: Example 4: How to exclude a file from a specific folder

segment.source: The following .xml file migrates all files and subfolders in C:EngineeringDrafts, except for the Sample.doc file in C:EngineeringDrafts.
segment.target: The following .xml file migrates all files and subfolders in C:EngineeringDrafts, except for the Sample.doc file in C:EngineeringDrafts.

segment.source: Example 5: How to exclude a file from any location
segment.target: Example 5: How to exclude a file from any location

segment.source: To exclude a Sample.doc file from any location on the C: drive, use the pattern element.
segment.target: To exclude a Sample.doc file from any location on the C: drive, use the pattern element.

segment.source: If multiple files exist with the same name on the C: drive, all of these files will be excluded.
segment.target: If multiple files exist with the same name on the C: drive, all of these files will be excluded.

segment.source: To exclude a Sample.doc file from any drive on the computer, use the script element.
segment.target: To exclude a Sample.doc file from any drive on the computer, use the script element.

segment.source: If multiple files exist with the same name, all of these files will be excluded.
segment.target: If multiple files exist with the same name, all of these files will be excluded.

segment.target: Examples of how to use XML to exclude files, folders, and registry keys

segment.target: Here are some examples of how to use XML to exclude files, folders, and registry keys.

segment.source: Note that all .docx, .xls and .ppt files will not be migrated because the unconditionalExclude element takes precedence over the include element.
segment.target: Note that all .docx, .xls and .ppt files will not be migrated because the unconditionalExclude element takes precedence over the include element.

segment.source: Create a Config.xml File
segment.target: Create a Config.xml File

segment.source: You can create and modify a Config.xml file if you want to exclude components from the migration.
segment.target: You can create and modify a Config.xml file if you want to exclude components from the migration.

segment.source: Excluding components using this file is easier than modifying the migration .xml files because you do not need to be familiar with the migration rules and syntax.
segment.target: Excluding components using this file is easier than modifying the migration .xml files because you do not need to be familiar with the migration rules and syntax.

segment.source: Config.xml is an optional file that you can create using the /genconfig command-line option with the ScanState tool.
segment.target: Config.xml is an optional file that you can create using the /genconfig command-line option with the ScanState tool.

segment.source: For example, you can use the Config.xml file to exclude the settings for one of the default applications.
segment.target: For example, you can use the Config.xml file to exclude the settings for one of the default applications.

segment.source: In addition, creating and modifying this file is the only way to exclude the operating-system settings that are migrated to computers running Windows.
segment.target: In addition, creating and modifying this file is the only way to exclude the operating-system settings that are migrated to computers running Windows.

segment.source: To exclude the settings for a default application: Specify for the application under the Applications section of the Config.xml file.
segment.target: To exclude the settings for a default application: Specify for the application under the Applications section of the Config.xml file.

segment.source: To exclude an operating system setting: Specify for the setting under the WindowsComponents section.
segment.target: To exclude an operating system setting: Specify for the setting under the WindowsComponents section.

segment.source: To exclude My Documents: Specify for My Documents under the Documents section.
segment.target: To exclude My Documents: Specify for My Documents under the Documents section.

segment.source: Note that any include rules in the .xml files will still apply.
segment.target: Note that any include rules in the .xml files will still apply.

segment.source: For example, if you have a rule that includes all the .docx files in My Documents, then only the .docx files will be migrated, but the rest of the files will not.
segment.target: For example, if you have a rule that includes all the .docx files in My Documents, then only the .docx files will be migrated, but the rest of the files will not.

segment.source: See Config.xml File for more information.
segment.target: See Config.xml File for more information.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To exclude a component from the Config.xml file, set the migrate value to "no".
segment.target: To exclude a component from the Config.xml file, set the migrate value to "no".

segment.source: Deleting the XML tag for the component from the Config.xml file will not exclude the component from your migration.
segment.target: Deleting the XML tag for the component from the Config.xml file will not exclude the component from your migration.
